## Introduction

This presentation summarizes key findings from the 2022 World Development Indicators dataset [@worldbank].

---

## Data Overview

```{python}
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

df = pd.read_csv("wdi.csv")
df.shape
```

---

## GDP per Capita vs Life Expectancy

```{python}
plot = df.dropna(subset=["gdp_per_capita", "life_expectancy"])

plt.figure()
plt.scatter(plot["gdp_per_capita"], plot["life_expectancy"])
plt.title("Life Expectancy vs GDP per Capita (2022)")
plt.xlabel("GDP per Capita")
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy")
plt.show()
```

Higher income countries tend to exhibit higher life expectancy.

---

## Top 10 Countries by GDP per Capita

```{python}
top10 = df.dropna(subset=["gdp_per_capita"]).sort_values("gdp_per_capita", ascending=False).head(10)

plt.figure()
plt.barh(top10["country"], top10["gdp_per_capita"])
plt.title("Top 10 Countries by GDP per Capita (2022)")
plt.gca().invert_yaxis()
plt.show()
```

These countries represent the highest income levels in 2022.

---

## Conclusion

- Significant income differences exist globally.
- Higher GDP per capita generally aligns with higher life expectancy.
- Inflation and macroeconomic conditions vary widely across countries.
